intro: Salvia sclarea var. hispanica, commonly known as Spanish clary or Spanish lavender, is a perennial herb native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and spikes of pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in perfumery and herbal medicine.
